::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**F2.8 Artesian springs and oases**](/efg-info/F2_8.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/F2_8_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: F2.8.web.mix v1.0.

> Freshwater ecoregions (Abell et al. 2008) were identified as containing occurrences of these functional groups if: i) their descriptions mentioned features consistent with those identified in the profile of the Ecosystem Functional Group; and ii) if their location was consistent with the ecological drivers described in the profile. Within those areas, locations of small lakes (<100km2), excluding artificial lakes (inclusion on types 1 and 3 only), were taken from the HydroLAKES database (Messager et al. 2016) and combined with global estimates of surface water phenology (classes 1, 2 and 7 from Pekel et al. 2016), occurrences were aggregated to 10 minutes spatial resolution.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**FEOW-2008** (Abell et al. 2008):

Source of _biogeographical range_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

 **GSW-1.1** (Pekel et al. 2016):

Source of _Surface water phenology_.
 Resolution: <1km2, periods/epochs.
 Accuracy evaluation: >90%.

 **HydroLAKES-1.0** (Messager et al. 2016):

Source of _Hydrography_.
 Resolution: <1km2, static.
 Accuracy evaluation: quantitative (subsets).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset        |url                                                                                                                                                                           |
|:--------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|FEOW-2008      |<https://www.feow.org/>{target='links'} :: <https://geospatial.tnc.org/datasets/38da4656e8074e1c820c42cc21cd76cd_0>{target='links'}                                           |
|GSW-1.1        |<https://global-surface-water.appspot.com/download>{target='links'} :: <https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/datasets/catalog/JRC_GSW1_1_YearlyHistory>{target='links'} |
|HydroLAKES-1.0 |<https://www.hydrosheds.org/page/hydrolakes>{target='links'}                                                                                                                  |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Reclassification* :: *Thresholds* :: *Buffering*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Medium quality map series*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Indirect,general*.

Ground observations are _no_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Quantitative accuracy assessment,documented,quantitative*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Indicative Map (**code: F2.8.IM.mix**, version v1.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: F2.8.web.mix**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**F2.8.IM.mix** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/F2.8.IM.mix_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

**F2.8.web.mix** (v1.0): [GitHub repository](F2.8.web.mix_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/F2.8.web.mix_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090958){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.F2_8_web_mix){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](layers/F2.8.web.mix_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map might have some restriction for commercial use, see details below.


::: {.cell}

## References

References used in this version of the maps.

- Abell R, Thieme ML, Revenga C, Bryer M, Kottelat M, Bogutskaya N, Coad B, Mandrak N, Contreras Balderas S, Bussing W, Stiassny MLJ, Skelton P, Allen GR, Unmack P, Naseka A, Ng R, Sindorf N, Robertson J, Armijo E, Higgins JV, Heibel TJ, Wikramanayake E, Olson D, López HL, Reis RE, Lundberg JG, Sabaj Pérez MH, Petry P (2008) *Freshwater ecoregions of the world: A new map of biogeographic units for freshwater biodiversity conservation*, **BioScience** 58: 403–414. DOI:[10.1641/B580507](https://doi.org/10.1641/B580507) 
 - Pekel JF, Cottam A, Gorelick N, Belward AS (2016) *High-resolution mapping of global surface water and its long-term changes* **Nature** 540, 418-422 [DOI:10.1038/nature20584](http:dx.doi.org/10.1038/nature20584) 
 - Messager, M.L., Lehner, B., Grill, G., Nedeva, I., Schmitt, O.  (2016) *Estimating the volume and age of water stored in global lakes using a geo-statistical approach* **Nature Communications** 13603 [DOI:10.1038/ncomms13603](http:dx.doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)
